resources.string:
"
----- Below is the current game state ----- {0} ----- Above is the current game state -----
"
Press & long-press are no longer swapped

"Please send your feedback to {0} and include the following information, as well as a saved file of the current game if possible:
{1}"
Your device is missing the Storage Access Framework, please report this so I can investigate.
Failed to write a temporary file to share, please report this so I can investigate.
failed to write to cache directory
This looks much too big to be a saved game
You have an unfinished game of {0} which this will replace. Continue loading?

"To import this file an extra permission is needed. Android might describe this permission in terms of photos and media.
If you don't want to grant it you can instead locate the file from within Puzzles using the Open button on the game chooser."

Could not open {0} because permission was denied. You can either locate the file from within Puzzles (use the Open button on the game chooser) or you can go to the Settings app, then Apps, Puzzles, Permissions, and grant storage permission.
Because of a bug in Android, the permission grant will not take effect until you restart Puzzles (swipe it away in Recent Apps).
Buttons when a game is completed
Shortcuts to start a new or different game
Long press to star a game
The current game has no seed because it was generated from a Game ID. The value above is an empty seed.
Keep screen on while in the foreground
Night mode can be disabled in Settings
Allows auto repeat (otherwise in action bar)
"Adds all pencil marks, removes \"obvious\" ones, can solve entire puzzle"
E.g. explain long-press when starting a game
Locate the balls inside the box by firing lasers and observing how they are deflected or absorbed.
Connect the islands with the given bridge counts so no bridges are crossing.
Roll the cube to collect all the paint.
Pair the numbers to form a complete and distinct set of dominoes.
Slide tiles around to form a grid in numerical order.
Number the squares to form regions with the same number, which is also the size of the region.
Turn over squares until all are light side up, but flipping one flips its neighbours.
Try to get the whole grid to be the same colour within the given number of moves, by repeatedly flood-filling the top left corner in different colours.
Divide the grid into 180-degree rotationally symmetric regions each centred on a dot.
Guess the hidden colour sequence: black is correct, white is the correct colour in the wrong place.
Move the ball around to collect all the gems without hitting a mine.
Enter digits so every row and column contains exactly one of each digit and the arithmetic clues are satisfied.
Place lamps so all squares are lit, no lamp lights another and numbered squares have the given number of adjacent lamps.
Draw a single unbroken and uncrossing line such that numbered squares have the given number of edges filled.
Place magnets and blanks to satisfy the +/- counts and avoid magnets repelling.
Copy the 4 colours to colour the map with no regions of the same colour touching.
Uncover all squares except the mines using the given counts of adjacent mines. *N.B.* Game is generated after first move; you may see \"not responding\" warnings.
Rotate tiles to connect all tiles (not just endpoints) to the centre tile.
Slide rows and columns to connect all tiles (not just endpoints) to the centre tile.

Draw lines along the grid edges, in such a way that the grid is divided into connected regions, all of the size shown in the status line. Also, each square containing a number should have that many of its edges drawn in.
Fill the grid so that the numbers are the length of each stretch of black tiles in order.
Draw a single loop with corners on black, before/after white, and not vice versa.
Remove pegs by jumping others over them, until only one is left.
Place black squares to limit the visible distance from each numbered cell.
Divide the grid into rectangles containing only one number, which is also the area of the rectangle.
Remove groups (2 or more) of the same colour to clear the grid, scoring more for larger groups.
Connect the squares into a path following the arrows.
Remove numbers so no number appears twice in any row/column, no two black squares are adjacent and the white squares are all connected.
Slide rows and columns around to form a grid in numerical order.
Draw diagonal lines in every square such that circles have the given numbers of lines meeting at them and there are no loops.
Fill the grid so each block, row and column contains exactly one of each digit.
Place tents so each tree has a separate adjacent tent (not diagonally), no tents are next to each other (even diagonally) and the row and column counts are correct.
Place towers so each row/column contains one of each height and each clue matches the number of towers visible looking into the grid from that point.
Complete the track from A to B so that the rows and columns contain the numbers of track segments indicated. The track may not cross itself.
Rotate groups of 4 to form a grid in numerical order.
Fill the grid with monsters so the correct numbers of them can be seen from each point, taking mirrors into account.
Enter digits so every row and column contains exactly one of each digit and the greater-than signs are satisfied.

Colour every square either black or white such that no three consecutive squares, horizontally or vertically, are the same colour, and each row and column contains the same number of black and white squares.
Move points around until no lines cross.
Tap a colour to flood fill from the top left
Drag colours into place, then tap smaller pegs when done
Tap two edges of a square to place track
Long press to mark a divider
Long press and drag to place an arrow marker
Long press to lock a peg
Long press to make a pencil mark
Long press to place a blank
Long press and drag to make a pencil mark
Long press to place a flag
Long press to lock a square
Long press to mark white squares
Long press to mark a cross
Long press and drag to connect inbound rather than outbound
Long press to circle a number
Long press to make a pencil mark
Long press to mark a blank square
Long press to make a pencil mark
Long press to make a pencil mark
Long press to make a pencil mark
Long press to mark a white square
Data does not appear to be a saved game file
Data was incorrectly formatted for a saved game file
Cannot handle this version of the saved game file format
Save file is from a different game
Save file is not from a game in this collection
Number of states in save file was negative
Two state counts provided in save file
Long-term parameters in save file are invalid
Short-term parameters in save file are invalid
Game description in save file is missing
Game description in save file is invalid
Game private description in save file is invalid
Game position in save file is out of range
Save file contained an invalid move
Save file contained an invalid restart move
Barrier probability may not be negative
Barrier probability may not be greater than 1
Excess junk at end of string
Grid area must be greater than one
Not enough data to fill grid
Number out of range in game description
Solution not known for this puzzle
Too much data to fit in grid
Unable to find a unique solution for this puzzle
Width must be at least one
Height must be at least one
Width and height must both be at least two
Width and height must both be greater than zero
Widths and heights greater than 255 are not supported
Minimum number of balls may not be greater than maximum
Too many balls to fit in grid
This game does not support the Solve operation
No game set up to solve
No game set up to print
Width and height must be at least 3
%age of island squares must be between 1% and 30%
Expansion factor must be between 0 and 100
Generated aux string is not a valid move (!).
Game does not have a (non-recursive) solution.
Both grid dimensions must be greater than zero
At least one grid dimension must be greater than zero
Not enough grid space to place all blue faces
Not enough space to place the solid on an empty square
Not enough hex digits at start of string
Maximum face number must be at least one
Incorrect number balance in game description
Sorry, I couldn\'t find a solution
No solution exists for this position
Width and height must both be at least 3
Must have at least one guess
Disallowing multiple colours requires at least as many colours as pegs
Grid area must be at least six squares
More than one starting square specified
Unable to find a solution from this starting point
Too much data in block structure specification
Too few clues for block structure
Subtraction and division blocks must have area 2
Expected comma after block structure description
Too many clues for block structure
Width and height must be at least 2
Percentage of black squares must be between 5% and 100%
4-fold symmetry is only available with square grids
Unable to find a solution to this puzzle.
Width and height for this grid type must both be at least %d
At least one of width and height for this grid type must be at least %d
Description too short for board size
Description too long for board size
Width and height must be at least two
Must have at least five regions
Too many regions to fit in grid
Too much data in edge list
Too little data in edge list
Edge list defines the wrong number of regions
Too little data in clue list
Too much data in clue list
Width and height must both be greater than two
Too many mines for grid size
No initial mine count in game description
No \',\' after initial x-coordinate in game description
No uniqueness specifier in game description
No \',\' after uniqueness specifier in game description
Initial x-coordinate was out of range
No initial y-coordinate in game description
Initial y-coordinate was out of range
No \',\' after initial y-coordinate in game description
Game has not been started yet
At least one of width and height must be greater than one
No wrapping puzzle with a width or height of 2 can have a unique solution
Width and height must both be greater than one
at least one column contains more numbers than will fit
at least one row contains more numbers than will fit
Solving algorithm cannot complete this puzzle
Width and height must both be greater than three
This board type is only supported at 7x7
Error: w + h is too big
Expansion factor may not be negative
Number of colours must be at least three
Too many colours makes given grid size impossible
Width and height cannot both be two
"X" (require every number in each main diagonal)
Both dimensions must be at least 2
Dimensions greater than 255 are not supported
Unable to support more than 31 distinct symbols in a puzzle
Killer puzzle dimensions must be smaller than 10.
Not enough data in block structure specification
A jigsaw block is too big
A jigsaw block is too small
Expected jigsaw block structure in game description
Expected killer block structure in game description
Expected killer clue grid in game description
Unexpected data at end of game description
No solution exists for this puzzle
Multiple solutions exist for this puzzle
Width and height must both be at least four
Not enough numbers given after grid specification
Unexpected additional data at end of game description
Grid size must be between 3 and 9
Too few clues for grid size
Too many clues for grid size
Rotating block size must be at least two
Width must be at least the rotating block size
Height must be at least the rotating block size
Order must be at least 5 for Adjacent puzzles of this difficulty
Expecting flag URDL in game description
Number of points must be at least four
Expected \'-\' after number in game description
Expected \',\' after number in game description
